Event.0: English playwright Harold Pinter, who achieved international renown—and was awarded the 2005 Nobel Prize for Literature—as one of the most complex and challenging post-World War II dramatists, died at age 78.
Event.1: Japanese actor Mifune Toshirō, known internationally for his energetic, flamboyant portrayals of samurai characters, especially in films directed by Kurosawa Akira, died near Tokyo.
Event.2: Chaminade, with a student body of only 850 students, beats #1 ranked Virginia 77-72 in a Honolulu holiday basketball classic
Event.3: The Soviet Union invaded Afghanistan to aid the Afghan communist government in its conflict with anticommunist Muslim guerrillas during the Afghan War.
Event.4: American writer Stephenie Meyer—author of the popular Twilight Saga, a series of vampire-themed novels for teenagers—was born.
Event.5:
Stephenie Meyer
American author
was born
Event.6: Idris I, head of the Sanūsiyyah (a Sufi Muslim brotherhood), was proclaimed king of an independent United Kingdom of Libya.
Event.7:
Lemmy Kilmister
British musician
was born
Event.8: US President FDR appoints General Eisenhower Supreme Commander of the Allied forces
Event.9: General Dwight D. Eisenhower was appointed supreme commander of the Allied Expeditionary Force during World War II.
Event.10: Admiral François Darlan, a leading figure in Marshal Philippe Pétain's Vichy government, was assassinated in Algiers.
Event.11: 1st radioactive isotope medicine administered in Berkeley, California
Event.12: Chemist Percy Lavon Julian weds sociologist Anna Roselle Johnson
Event.13:
Ava Gardner
American actress
was born
Event.14: BBC broadcasts first British radio play "The Truth about Father Christmas"
Event.15: Famous pilot Jimmy Doolittle (21) weds high school sweetheart Josephine E. Daniels
Event.16: Agatha Miller (later best selling detective author) marries aviator Archibald Christie
Event.17:
Howard Hughes
American manufacturer, aviator, and motion-picture producer
was born
Event.18: American manufacturer, aviator, and film producer Howard Hughes, who was known for his reclusiveness and for the uses to which he put his vast wealth, was born.
Event.19: Daniel Stover & William Hance patent bicycle with back pedal brake
Event.20: Giusseppi Verdi's "Aida" opera premieres in Cairo
Event.21:
Elisabeth
empress consort of Austria
was born
Event.22: English Victorian poet Matthew Arnold, a literary and social critic noted especially for his Classical attacks on the contemporary tastes and manners of the “Barbarians” (the aristocracy), the “Philistines” (the commercial middle class), and the “Populace,” was born.
Event.23: Treaty of Ghent signed, ending the War of 1812 between the United States, the United Kingdom and their allies
Event.24:
Treaty of Ghent
On this day in 1814, the United States and Great Britain signed the Treaty of Ghent in Belgium, ending the War of 1812, marking a decline of American dependence on Europe, and stimulating a sense of U.S. nationalism.
Event.25: Compromise of the Nobles in Habsburg Netherlands closes against inquisition
